description: Wednesday: A stinky flower in the Bronx, goodbye to the Big Apple Circus, and a slower ferry.
title: New York Today: Awaiting a Corpse Flower Bloom
title_page: New York Today: Awaiting a Corpse Flower Bloom - The New York Times
text:
Updated, 7:48 a.m.
Good morning on this totally toasty Wednesday.
The smell of rotting flesh will soon be wrinkling noses in the Bronx.
A corpse flower is on the verge of blooming at the New York Botanical Garden, possibly today or Thursday.
The plant’s common name comes from the stench it produces to attract pollinators like carrion beetles and flies.
(It also has a scientific name with a charm of its own: Amorphophallus titanum, or “large misshapen phallus.”)
